info.description:
# Introduction
Scalekit API is modeled around the [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/REST) architecture style. That means, our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts form-encoded request bodies and produces JSON formatted responses, uses standard HTTP verbs and error codes.

## Getting Started
If you are just getting started, you can also refer to our [Quick Start Guide](/single-sign-on/quickstart-sso).

Apart from REST APIs, we have published SDKs in some of the popular languages as shown below. You can use these SDKs and integrate with Scalekit much faster.

- [NodeJS](https://github.com/scalekit-inc/scalekit-sdk-node)
- [Go Lang](https://github.com/scalekit-inc/scalekit-sdk-go)

Some additional instructions around using our APIs

- API Endpoint Host must use the `Environment URL` of the environment you are targeting.
- API requests without appropriate authentication headers will fail with 401 status code.

Read below to understand more about how to authenticate the API calls and how to handle errors appropriately.


# API Authentication
Scalekit API uses [OAuth2 Client Credentials](https://www.oauth.com/oauth2-servers/access-tokens/client-credentials) based authentication. You can view and manage the necessary information from your `API Config` section in the Scalekit Dashboard.

You will need the following information to authenticate with Scalekit APIs
- Client ID
- Client Secret
- Environment URL

You can obtain a secure token by making `POST` call to the `https://{ENV_URL}/oauth/token` endpoint and sending client_id and client_secret as part of the request body.

```shell
$ curl https://{ENV_URL}/oauth/token \
  -X POST \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  -d 'client_id={client_id}' \
  -d 'client_secret={client_secret}' \
  -d 'grant_type=client_credentials'\
```

Upon successful processing, you will receive the access token as part of the JSON response as shown in example below:
```json
{
  "access_token": "DCRD10-e7c5c8139165228a82e442445fe01c16",
  "token_type": "bearer",
  "expires_in": 1799
}
```
The `access_token` is the OAuth access token you need to use for all subsequent API calls to Scalekit.

To make a request to one of our APIs, you need to include the access token in the Authorization header of the request as Bearer 'access_token' like the following example shows:
```shell
$ curl --request GET "https://{ENV_URL}/api/v1/organizations" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer {access_token}"
```

Please make sure that you keep your Client Secrets safely. Do not share your client secret in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, etc. Refer to [this guide](/security/client-secrets) to understand some of the best practices around keeping client secrets secure.

Our SDKs will automatically handle the API authentication and error handling to make the job of using our APIs much easier for you.

# Error Handling
As mentioned earlier, Scalekit APIs return appropriate HTTP Status Codes along with the detailed error messages in case of invalid usage of APIs.

In general:
- `200 or 201`: API request is successful
- `400`: The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter.
- `401`: Invalid Authentication Headers found in the request.
- `404`: Resource not found
- `429`: Too many requests hit the API too quickly. Retry the request after a cool-off period.
- `500 or 501 or 504`: Something went wrong at our end. However rare they are, we automatically log these requests for proactive support and fixing the underlying issue.

Along with HTTP Status Codes, we also respond with detailed error messages. An example error message for a 401 error is shown below.

```json
{
    "code": 16,
    "message": "Token empty",
    "details":
    [
        {
            "@type": "type.googleapis.com/scalekit.v1.errdetails.ErrorInfo",
            "error_code": "UNAUTHENTICATED"
        }
    ]
}
```

We strongly recommend you to handle errors gracefully while writing code using our SDKs.
info.title: Scalekit APIs

get.description:
Returns the OpenID Connect configuration values from the provider's Well-Known Configuration Endpoint, per the specification (https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html#ProviderConfigurationRequest). 

Sample Response below.
```
{
  "issuer": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com",
  "authorization_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/oauth/authorize",
  "token_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/oauth/token",
  "introspection_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/oauth/introspect",
  "userinfo_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/userinfo",
  "revocation_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/revoke",
  "end_session_endpoint": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/end_session",
  "jwks_uri": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com/keys",
  "scopes_supported": [
    "openid",
    "profile",
    "offline_access"
  ],
  "response_types_supported": [
    "code"
  ],
  "response_modes_supported": [
    "query"
  ],
  "grant_types_supported": [
    "authorization_code",
    "client_credentials",
    "refresh_token"
  ],
  "subject_types_supported": [
    "public"
  ],
  "id_token_signing_alg_values_supported": [
    "RS256"
  ],
  "request_object_signing_alg_values_supported": [
    "RS256"
  ],
  "token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported": [
    "none",
    "client_secret_basic",
    "client_secret_post",
    "private_key_jwt"
  ],
  "token_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_supported": [
    "RS256"
  ],
  "revocation_endpoint_auth_methods_supported": [
    "none",
    "client_secret_basic",
    "client_secret_post",
    "private_key_jwt"
  ],
  "revocation_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_supported": [
    "RS256"
  ],
  "introspection_endpoint_auth_methods_supported": [
    "client_secret_basic",
    "private_key_jwt"
  ],
  "introspection_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_supported": [
    "RS256"
  ],
  "claims_supported": [
    "sub",
    "aud",
    "exp",
    "iat",
    "iss",
    "auth_time",
    "nonce",
    "acr",
    "amr",
    "c_hash",
    "at_hash",
    "act",
    "scopes",
    "client_id",
    "azp",
    "preferred_username",
    "name",
    "family_name",
    "given_name",
    "locale",
    "email",
    "email_verified",
    "phone_number",
    "phone_number_verified"
  ],
  "code_challenge_methods_supported": [
    "S256"
  ],
  "ui_locales_supported": [
    "en"
  ],
  "request_parameter_supported": true,
  "request_uri_parameter_supported": false
}

```

200.description: Success . Please refer to the OpenID Provider Metadata properties here ( https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html#ProviderMetadata )

parameters.description: placeholder
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: Token to access the next page of results

parameters.name: organization

parameters.description: Organization ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization to update settings
parameters.name: id

get.description: Obtain detailed information about a specific connection within an organization

parameters.description: Organization ID for the Connection.
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Connection ID. Unique ID for the connection
parameters.name: id

patch.description: Deactivate an existing SSO connection for the specified organization.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization associated with the connection
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the connection to be toggled

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization associated with the connection

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. This ID is used to retrieve directories associated with the specified organization.
parameters.name: organization_id

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of directories

get.description: Retrieves a list of all groups within a specified directory for an organization. This endpoint allows you to view the group structures within your connected Directory Providers.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory within the organization
parameters.name: directory_id

parameters.description: Number of groups to return per page (default: 10, max: 30)
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Token for pagination. Use the value returned in the previous response to fetch the next page of results
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: Filter groups updated after the specified timestamp (RFC 3339 format)
parameters.name: updated_after

parameters.description: If true, include the full group payload in the response; otherwise, only basic information is returned (default: false)
parameters.name: include_detail

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of groups from the specified directory

get.description: Retrieves a list of all users within a specified directory for an organization. This endpoint allows you to view user accounts associated with your connected Directory Providers.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory within the organization
parameters.name: directory_id

parameters.description: Number of users to return per page. Maximum value is 30. If not specified, defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Token for pagination. Use the value returned in the 'next_page_token' field of the previous response to retrieve the next page of results
parameters.name: page_token

parameters.description: If set to true, the response will include the full user payload with all available details. If false or not specified, only essential user information will be returned
parameters.name: include_detail

parameters.description: Filter users by their membership in a specific directory group
parameters.name: directory_group_id

parameters.description: Filter users that were updated after the specified timestamp. Use RFC 3339 format
parameters.name: updated_after

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of users from the specified directory

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific directory within an organization. This endpoint allows you to view the properties and configuration of a connected Directory Provider

parameters.description: Unique identifier to an Organization
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of a Directory
parameters.name: id

patch.description: Enables a directory, allowing it to be used for user management and authentication

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organization

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the directory within the organization
parameters.name: id

get.description: List all Organizations in the Environment with given query. The query can be any one of name, organizationID or externalID, if more than one organization matches the query string multiple results are returned. The response contains page_token that can be used to access the next page of results.

parameters.description: query to search for. The search is case insensitive. minimum length should be 3
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Number of results to be returned. Max supported page_size is 30
parameters.name: page_size

get.description: Fetch a comprehensive list of available connection providers for integration

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of connection providers

get.description:
Authorization URL initiates the Login flow with Scalekit.

Scalekit expects atleast one of the following parameters to be present. The parameters are used to determine the SSO connection used to Login in the user. 

`domain` - Email domain of the user. Domain should be mapped to an Organization. The SSO connection from the org would be used to login to the app.

`connection_id` - ID of the SSO connection. If the Connection's status is `active`, the user will be redirected to the SSO Connection's identity provider configured.

`organization_id` -  ID of Organization. The user will be redirected to the SSO connection's identity provider configured for that organization.

`provider` -  ID of SSO Provider, Incase of Social Logins . e.g `google`

parameters.description: The client ID string that you obtain from the API Credentials page
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: Determines where the response is sent. The value of this parameter must exactly match one of the authorized redirect values that you set in the API Credentials page (including the HTTP or HTTPS scheme, case, and trailing '/', if any).
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: Domain part of the email address that is mapped to an organization. Example. yourcustomer.com
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description: Connection ID for which the SSO flow must be initiated for. If the Connection's status is `active`, the user will be redirected to the SSO Connection's identity provider configured
parameters.name: connection_id

parameters.description: Organization ID for which the SSO flow must be initiated for. Based on the organization ID supplied, the user will be redirected to the SSO connection's identity provider configured for that organization.
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description: Key for the Social SSO Provider. This is common to all Organizations. e.g. `google`, `github`, `linkedin`, `gitlab`, `microsoft`, `salesforce`
parameters.name: provider

parameters.description: Value must be `code`
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: Value must be `openid email profile`
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description:
An opaque string that is round-tripped in the protocol; that is to say, it is returned back as-is as a URI parameter in the Basic flow. The state can be useful for correlating requests and responses. Because your redirect_uri can be guessed, using a state value can increase your assurance that an incoming connection is the result of an authentication request initiated by your app.

State will be useful if you would like to retain some information about the user that you would like to use at the end of the login flow. E.g. deep link URL in your product to redirect the user to after a successful login.

If you generate a random string or encode the hash of some client state (e.g., a cookie) in this state variable, you can validate the response to additionally ensure that the request and response originated in the same browser. This additional validation offers protection against attacks such as cross-site request forgery.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: A random value generated by your app that enables replay protection.
parameters.name: nonce

parameters.description: When your app knows the email address of the user it is trying to authenticate, it can provide this parameter as a hint to the authentication server and Scalekit will pass this information to your customer's identity provider. Some identity providers prefill the login box with this value to make the login experience easier for the end user.
parameters.name: login_hint

parameters.description: A challenge code generated from `code_verifier` that is required for PKCE flows. This is used ensure if the request was handled by the right parties. The string is stored by Scalekit to be used when validating the token request with a `code_verifier`.  A code_challenge is generated as follows `code_challenge = SHA256(code_verifier)` .
parameters.name: code_challenge

parameters.description: The algorithm used to process the code challenge. The value should be `S256`
parameters.name: code_challenge_method

post.description: The code provided to the Redirect URI. Code can be exchanged for a ID Token containing the user details using the Token URL.

parameters.description: The code received by the Redirect URI as part of the Authentication Response.
parameters.name: code

parameters.description: The redirect URI where this code was received. This will used to validate the code to make the code was infact generated for this redirect_uri.
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: Unique client ID that represents your application.
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: The client secret to authorize the client.
parameters.name: client_secret

parameters.description: Grant Type must be `authorization_code`.
parameters.name: grant_type

parameters.description: Used in PKCE flow, code_verifier is derived from the `code_challenge` presented at the Authorization Endpoint
parameters.name: code_verifier

configuration_type.description: Method used to configure the connection

debug_enabled.description: Enables debug mode, allowing non-HTTPS endpoints

enabled.description: Indicates if the connection is active for organization users

key_id.description: Unique identifier for the connection key

organization_id.description: Unique identifier of the associated organization

provider.description: SSO provider (e.g., OKTA, Google, Azure AD)

enabled.description: Indicates whether Connection active for Org users
Indicates whether Connection active for Organization users

error_message.description: Error message if the connection toggle fails

attribute_mappings.description: Mappings between directory attributes and Scalekit user and group attributes

directory_endpoint.description: The endpoint URL generated by Scalekit for synchronizing users and groups from the Directory Provider

directory_provider.description: The Directory Provider connected to this directory, such as Okta, OneLogin or Microsoft Entra ID

directory_type.description: Type of the directory, indicating the protocol or standard used for synchronization

enabled.description: Indicates whether the directory is currently enabled and actively synchronizing users and groups

last_synced_at.description: Timestamp of the last successful synchronization of users and groups from the Directory Provider

name.description: Name of the directory, typically representing the connected Directory Provider

organization_id.description: Unique identifier of the organization to which the directory belongs

role_assignments.description: Role assignments associated with the directory, defining group based role assignments

secrets.description: List of secrets used for authenticating and synchronizing with the Directory Provider

stats.description: Statistics and metrics related to the directory, such as synchronization status and error counts

total_groups.description: Total number of groups in the directory

total_users.description: Total number of users in the directory

directory.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific directory within an organization. This endpoint allows you to view the properties and configuration of a connected Directory Provider

directories.description: A collection of directory objects associated with the organization.

groups.description: List of directory groups retrieved from the specified directory. Each group contains information about its members

next_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results. This field is populated when there are more groups available than can be returned in the current response. Use this token in the next request to fetch the subsequent page of groups

prev_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the previous page of results. This field is populated when there are preceding pages of groups available. Use this token in the next request to fetch the prior page of groups, enabling backward navigation through the paginated results

total_size.description: Total number of groups available in the directory. This value represents the overall count of groups, regardless of pagination

next_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request to fetch the subsequent page of users.

prev_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the previous page of results. Use this token in the 'page_token' field of the next request to fetch the prior page of users.

total_size.description: Total number of users available in the directory that match the request criteria. This value represents the overall count of users, regardless of pagination.

users.description: List of directory users retrieved from the specified directory.

group_id.description: group ID for the role mapping

role_id.description: role ID for the role mapping

group_updated_at.description: Max time of Group Updated At for Directory

user_updated_at.description: Max time of User Updated At for Directory

enabled.description: Indicates whether the directory is currently enabled or disabled after the toggle operation. If true, the directory is enabled and actively synchronizing users and groups. If false, the directory is disabled and not synchronizing

error_message.description: If the toggle operation encountered an error, this field will contain a human-readable error message providing more details about the issue. If the operation was successful, this field will be empty

access_token.description:
Access token ( JWT ) 
A decoded payload example below.
```
{
  "aud": [
    "prd_skc_12511406029372224"
  ],
  "exp": 1715187475,
  "iat": 1715186575,
  "iss": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com",
  "jti": "tkn_18655216756882331",
  "nbf": 1715186575,
  "sub": "conn_12652966976715584;johndoe@acmecorp.com"
}
```

id_token.description:
ID Token ( JWT ) 
A decoded payload example below. For More details please refer [ID Token Claims](https://docs.scalekit.com/best-practices/idtoken-claims)
```
{
  "amr": [
    "conn_12652966976715584"
  ],
  "at_hash": "SEqh15so69NgXdYoHVW6Pw",
  "aud": [
    "prd_skc_12511406029372224"
  ],
  "azp": "prd_skc_12511406029372224",
  "c_hash": "BwHUQzZC9To9oOZ3z3NGMg",
  "client_id": "prd_skc_12511406029372224",
  "email": "johndoe@acmecorp.com",
  "exp": 1715190175,
  "iat": 1715186575,
  "iss": "https://rexinc.scalekit.com",
  "oid": "org_12649270050061120",
  "sub": "conn_12652966976715584;johndoe@acmecorp.com"
}
```

expire_time.description: Expiry time of the link. The link is valid for 1 week.

location.description: Location of the link. This is the URL that can be used to access the Admin portal. The link is valid for 1 week.

next_page_token.description: Token to access the next page of results

prev_page_token.description: Token to access the previous page of results

display_name.title: Name of the org to be used in display

external_id.description: Unique identifier that links an Organization Object to your app's tenant, stored as an External ID
external_id.title: External Id is useful to store a unique identifier for a given Org that. The unique Identifier can be the id of your tenant / org in your SaaSApp

region_code.description: Region code . Only US is supported
region_code.title: Optional regioncode

features.description: Organization settings features such as SSO and SCIM Provisioning

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

display_name.title: Name of the org to be used in display

external_id.description: Unique identifier that links an Organization Object to your app's tenant, stored as an External ID
external_id.title: External Id is useful to store a unique identifier for a given Org that. The unique Identifier can be the id of your tenant / org in your SaaSApp

v1organizationsUpdateOrganization.description: For update messages ensure the indexes are same as the base model itself.

tags.description:
Organization represents a customer or a tenant of your product. This is the top level entity and all the resources are mapped to this Organization object. Each organization will be uniquely identified by `organization_id`. You can use this service to create and manage Enterprise SSO Connections for an organization. **Attributes** | Attribute Name | Attribute Description | |---|---| | `id`
_string_ | Unique ID of an Organization. This attribute is required for all API operations to be performed against this organization. | | `display_name`
_string_ | Name of the Organization | | `create_time`
_string_ | Timestamp at which this organization record was created in [RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339) format. For Example: `2011-10-05T14:48:00.000Z` | | `update_time`
_string_ | Timestamp at which this organization record was last updated in [RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339) format. For Example:
`2021-10-05T14:48:00.000Z` | | `external_id`
_string_ | Unique ID of this organization according to your system. You can store your unique ID for this organization in Scalekit's system and later use this to fetch Organization and Connection details. This is helpful if you don't want to persist Scalekit's Unique Identifiers in your database. | | `metadata`
_object_ | JSON representation of any additional organization information that you want to store in Scalekit's system. Example: `{"key":"value"}` | | `region_code`
_string_ | Represents the Data Center region in which this organization's data is stored. Currently, it always returns `US` |
tags.name: Organization

tags.description:
Connection represents a unique Single Sign-on instance for an Organization. Connection has the configuration needed to establish an SSO and exchange user information securely between Scalekit and your customer's Identity Provider. Depending on the connection type parameter, the corresponding configuration details are found in `oidc_config` or `saml_config` parameter. **Connection Attributes** | Attribute Name | Attribute Description | |---|---| | `id`
_string_ | Unique ID of an SSO Connection. This attribute is required for all API operations to be performed against this connection. | | `provider`
_ENUM_ | Name of the Identity Provider. Possible Values are: `OKTA`, `GOOGLE`, `MICROSOFT_AD`, `AUTH0`, `ONELOGIN`, `PING_IDENTITY`, `JUMPCLOUD`, `CUSTOM` | | `type`
_ENUM_ | Protocol type that is used for this connection. Possible values are `SAML` or `OIDC` | | `status`
_ENUM_ | Indicates the configuration progress status of the SSO Connection. Possible Values are `DRAFT`, `INPROGRESS`, `COMPLETED`.
_Note_: This doesn't indicate whether this connection is active or not. | | `enabled`
_boolean_ | Indicates whether this connection is active or not. Users can only login via active SSO connections. | | `organization_id`
_string_ | Organization ID to which this SSO connection belongs to. | | `saml_config`
_Object_ | If this connection is of type `SAML`, the configuration details are found in this object. | | `oidc_config`
_Object_ | If this connection is of type `OIDC`, the configuration details are found in this object. | | `attribute_mapping`
_Object_ | Array of attribute mappings using which the user information received from the Identity Provider is normalized. Example:
{
   "email": "email",
   "family_name": "lastName",
   "given_name": "firstName",
   "sub": "nameid"
} | | `create_time` | Timestamp at which this connection record was created in [RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339) format. For Example: `2021-10-05T14:48:00.000Z` | | `update_time`
_string_ | Timestamp at which this connection record was last updated in [RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339) format. For Example: `2021-10-10T14:48:00.000Z` |
tags.name: Connection
